search_results.title: Cloud Networking
search_results.snippet: Cloud networking is a service or science in which a company's networking procedure is hosted on a public or private cloud.

search_results.title: Cloud Networking: What IT Teams Need to Know
search_results.snippet: Cloud networking refers to deploying and managing network resources, including hardware and software, over the cloud.

search_results.title: Cloud Infrastructure in 2025: Components, Models & Use ...
search_results.snippet: Networking is defined through software, using virtual routers, load balancers, and SDN overlays to connect resources.

search_results.title: Cloud Networking: Revolutionising Business IT Infrastructure
search_results.snippet: At its core, cloud networking refers to the use of cloud-based resources to manage, control and facilitate network infrastructure and services.

search_results.title: Cloud Networking: Benefits & Key Concepts Explained
search_results.snippet: Cloud networking refers to connecting and managing your network resources using cloud-based services instead of traditional on-premises hardware.

message.content: {"facts":["Cloud networking is the deployment and management of network resources, including hardware and software, hosted on public or private cloud infrastructures rather than on-premises equipment[1][2][4].","It leverages virtualization technologies to create virtual networks, subnets, and network interfaces, enabling flexible resource allocation and isolation[1][5].","Software-Defined Networking (SDN) is a core technology in cloud networking, decoupling network control from hardware to allow centralized, programmable management and automation of network configurations[1][2][4].","Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) provide isolated virtual network environments within the cloud, allowing organizations to define IP ranges, subnets, and routing for enhanced security and control[1][5].","Cloud networking includes virtual network functions (VNFs) that replace traditional hardware devices like firewalls, load balancers, and routers with software-based equivalents for easier deployment and scalability[2].","Network-as-a-Service (NaaS) is a cloud networking model where businesses subscribe to networking services hosted in the cloud instead of investing in physical infrastructure[4].","Cloud networking enables centralized management and monitoring of network operations through web portals or APIs, streamlining administration and improving control[2][5].","Load balancing in cloud networking distributes incoming traffic across multiple servers or instances to optimize performance, scalability, and fault tolerance[1][3].","Cloud networking supports hybrid cloud models, integrating public and private cloud infrastructures with seamless connectivity and consistent network policies[3].","Security in cloud networking is enhanced by advanced cloud provider features such as cloud-based firewalls, intrusion detection, encryption, and compliance controls, often exceeding typical on-premises capabilities[2][4][5].","Cloud networking facilitates scalability by allowing networks to dynamically scale up or down based on demand, supporting fluctuating traffic patterns efficiently[2][4].","Performance optimization in cloud networking involves monitoring traffic, identifying bottlenecks, and adjusting resources to maintain efficiency and cost-effectiveness[1].","Cloud networking underpins modern technologies like Internet of Things (IoT), remote work platforms, and edge computing by providing flexible, scalable connectivity[4].","Traditional networking relies on physical hardware (routers, switches, firewalls) managed on-premises, whereas cloud networking virtualizes these functions and manages them via software in the cloud[4][5].","Cloud networking reduces capital expenditure by eliminating the need for upfront hardware investments and shifts costs to a pay-as-you-go operational model[2][5]."],"statistics":[{"value":"Over 90% of enterprises are expected to adopt cloud networking solutions by
